alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 12:27PM EDT until May 01 at 11:41PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1227 PM EDT, emergency management reported flooding on roads in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The Piscataquis River is nearing flood stage at Blanchard. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of a tenth to a quarter of an inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Greenville, Guilford, Brownville Junction, Milo, Monson, Blanchard, Elliottsville, Kingsbury Plantation, Ebeemee, Orneville, Sangerville, Brownville, Parkman, Abbot, Sebec, Atkinson, Wellington, Shirley and Willimantic. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
